messages.subject: nihonshi reading group: Sansom's History of Japan to 1334
messages.msgSnippet: Kitsuno asked me to post a message that the nihonshi reading group will be reading next Sansom’s history of Japan to 1334. If anyone is interested in joining
messages.messageBody:
Kitsuno asked me to post a message that the nihonshi reading group will be
reading next Sansoms history of Japan to 1334. If anyone is interested in
joining us for reading, please feel free to subscribe to nihonshi. The link
to the group yahoogroups is:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nihonshi/



We also have our own dedicated website for more information about the
nihonshi group at:

www.nihonshi.org/



As most of you know, Sansoms three volume history is one of the classic
histories of Japan, in the English language. For those of you who wish to
get a solid overview of Japan history, or for those of you who wish to
review Japan history, this is a great opportunity. We will be reading and
discussing this book for the month of December. If you have any questions,
please feel free to email me.



Join us!



Regards,

Mike

tokyodog@...





_____

From: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com [mailto:samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com]
On Behalf Of Kitsuno
Sent: Saturday, November 11, 2006 4:13 PM
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [samuraihistory] Kyushu Tandai vs. Chinzei Kanrei



Was there a difference between the title/position of Kyushu Tandai and
Chinzei Kanrei during the Kamakura period, or are these two names for
the same thing?





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Kyushu Tandai vs. Chinzei Kanrei
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/10/2006 11:23:19 PM Pacific Standard Time, samurai-listowner@samurai-archives.com writes: Kyushu  Tandai I believe it to be the same.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/10/2006 11:23:19 PM Pacific Standard Time,
samurai-listowner@... writes:

Kyushu Tandai


I believe it to be the same.

Nakagawa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
